sub_title: Growing a better world together with Data || Global Data|Governance Platform/DevOps Architect bij Rabobank || 🆁🅷🅲🅰 Ḷṿḷ. ЇЇЇ® || Rᴇᴅ Hᴀᴛ Aᴄᴄᴇʟᴇʀᴀᴛᴏʀ
summary:
Moustafa ElZeny is an accomplished Principal Cloud|Linux Consultant, Infrastructure / Systems Architect, and Kubernetes "K8S" Consultant with over 15 years of experience in the technology industry. He is a Red Hat Certified Architect (RHCA) and one of the few EMEA Red Hat Certified Examiners (RHCX) and EMEA Red Hat Certified Instructors (RHCI). 

Moustafa has a proven track record of delivering UNIX/Linux solutions and has more than 11 years of experience in the UNIX & Linux domains. He is also an expert in Docker/Containers/Kubernetes/SoX, and has worked on a variety of platforms including Red Hat, SUSE, CentOS, Fedora, Oracle UEK, Kali, Mandriva, ArchLinux, and UNIX platforms such as BSD-Series and Oracle Solaris. 

Throughout his career, Moustafa has worked on various positions related to Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher Labs, SIEM Solutions (e.g. Splunk, SIEMonster), Red Hat Solutions (e.g. Ansible, OpenShift 3.9 to 4.1, OpenStack Platform 6.0 to 13.0, Satellite 5.7 to 6.3, IDM, RHEL Atomic Host, RHEV-M|H 3.5 to 4.1, Pacemaker), SUSE Solutions (e.g. SLES, Systems Deployment), and Hardware Platforms (Oracle SPARC, ZFS Storage, ORACLE Tape Library, Oracle FS1-2). 

Moustafa is passionate about open-source technologies and has been an active participant in the open-source community since 2005. He has successfully delivered a wide range of professional services, including consultancy, implementation, and training, covering different Linux platforms, and UNIX platforms. His experiences have been concentrated on a variety of domains and he has successfully covered a matrix of technologies and vendors across GCC, EMAE & ANZ.

Moustafa is a highly certified professional with up to 38 recognized international certificates from Red Hat, SUSE, edX, and Oracle. He has successfully delivered numerous projects for well-known profiles like Saudi Border Guards, Omnix & Etisalat UAE, CBUAE, CIB (Egypt), Riyadh Bank, Abu Dhabi International Petroleum, SITA for Aviation, Zain Sudan, Arab Bank (Amman), Audi Bank (Egypt), and NEC with enthusiasm and professionalism.

Moustafa has conducted and delivered Red Hat (Basic | Advanced) courses and exams for more than 500 and 90 candidates, respectively. He has also prepared several trainers to teach Red Hat courses who are now working as Red Hat instructors in major Red Hat CTPs.

Moustafa is passionate about sharing his knowledge with others and strives to be an ambassador who helps people. Based on his beliefs, he is attached to one of R. Kelly's song lyrics, "I believe I can fly, I believe I can touch the sky."

projects.title: SIEMonster Installation, Implementation, Configuration, and Deployment in Production
projects.description:
➣ I was Involved in a big engagement with Saudi Border Guards. I have played my role inside their
premises for four months as a SIEM Architect.
➣ During that period I was responsible for Designing, Configuring, Installing and Building SIEMonster
Solution based on Rancher Labs in a Containerized environemnt.
➣ I have made my design upon five nodes with high configuration (VM instances) built from
vCenter/vShpere environment.
➣ Deploying user stack for SIEMonster v3 final release as a set of containers and their replications using the meaning of Kuberenetes in a pretty dashboard that driven from Rancher Labs UI.
➣ Defining communication matrix for required ports (Src Port/Dst Port) across environment itself and
inside Intranet.
➣ Configuring SIEMonster environment and enabling SIEMonster dashboard Integrating with Splunk to guarantee high accuracy from gatherd data, events, and logs.
➣ Visualizing all agthered data in some sort of well organized graphs.

projects.title: Performing a health check matrix for bare-metal and virtual instances / Red Hat Satellite Server Migration
projects.description:
➣ I have been involved in a big engagement journal of Red Hat Satellite Server implementation for Riyadh Bank, Taking care about installations and configurations of Red Hat Satellite in their Virtualized environment according to Riyadh's Bank requirements.
➣ Installation and configuration of the VMs that will host the product and the one that will be used for
testing purposes.
➣ Installation of one Satellite Server and made the initial server configuration.
➣ Attaching the subscriptions to the Satellite Sever.
➣ Synchronization of the required repositories.
➣ Applying the required configurations.
➣ Configuring Virt-who and discovery of the ESXi hosts.
➣ Connecting two VMs with two different Red Hat flavors and updating them through Satellite for testing purposes.
➣ Applying and testing the required configurations for puppet motd module.
➣ Testing registration of other VLANS.
➣ Registering of the provided RHEL clients to the corresponding Satellite server.
➣ It is worth highlighting that the following the common hardening rules were applied to the Satellite
VM:
    o Minimal Packages are only installed.
    o Firewall is enabled.
    o SELinux "Security Enhanced Linux" is disabled.
    o Partitioned the disk and distribute the File-systems according to the recommendations.
    o Latest updates are applies on the installed servers.
    o Only the required services are running.
➣ In addition I was responsible to train staffs everything regarding administration tasks upon Red Hat
Enterprise Linux Systems and how to troubleshoot any issues might be happened.

projects.title: Cloud Automation System (CAS) - [ MCIT Graduation Project ] ♦ Senior Supervisor
projects.description:
▩ Description:
➣ This is the 3rd one of graduation projects for MCIT scholarship in specialized UNIX/Linux Systems Administration Track I supervised as a goal of my job.
➣ This project has a wide vision in that time to make a breakthrough in Clouding technology at the Infrastructure sector that known as IaaS "Infrastructure as a Service" to achieve transparency, remote storage via shared storage whatever SAN or NAS.
➣ The especial thing in CAS, that all of members are girls, but actually I considered them as a Ninja girls not normal girls cause all of them was working in a dedicated sector hardly, seriously, effectively, and with more professionalism.
➣ CAS had been deployed and implemented over RDO using the automation tool "Packstack", my Ninga girls at that time have had the ability to build IaaS distributed among more than three node such as Nova compute, Nove controller, Quantum and Neutron for networking node,etc..
➣ Actually, I'm pretty sure that all of my Ninga girls strive like a tool to make a revolution in their practical life nowadays, and I'm so proud that I trained, supervised, and worked will them over seven months of seriousness and commitment.

▩ Technologies used:
➣ OpenStack (Ice House and Grizzely)
➣ Packstack, Puppet
➣ IaaS
➣ Mult-tier nodes
➣ Virtualization
➣ Yum, NTP
➣ OpenSSH + Host Authentication

▩ Operating Systems used:
➣ ORACLE UEK v6.5
➣ CentOS v6.5
➣ Fedora ( for testing issues )
➣ PartedMagic ( for partitioning issues )

▩ Job Role: 
➣ Senior Supervisor for the project
➣ Consultant for all one in the team

▩ Team Leader:
➣ Menna Aboelela a.k.a Ubuntu geek

▩ Team Members:
➣ Reem Ahmed a.k.a Talented Linuxer ( mentioned here ) 
➣ Hanan Hussein a.k.a Linux Nerd ( mentioned here )
➣ Eman Mahmoud a.k.a Judge girl
➣ Basma Zidan a.k.a Ambitious girl

projects.title: Freedom Project - [ MCIT Graduation Project ] ♦ Senior Supervisor
projects.description:
▩ Description:
➣ This is one of graduation projects for MCIT scholarship in specialized UNIX/Linux Systems Administration Track I supervised as a goal of my job. 
➣ This project has a wide vision about how to administer servers running under UNIX/Linux platforms such as Oracle unbreakable Linux v6.5 and Oracle Solaris v11.1.
➣ MCIT trainees have a vision in that time to implement this project as a Demo for a Multi-national Company called Freedom with a main branch in Egypt and two other branches in KSA and 
UAE.
➣ This company works on a large production so they decided to use a powerful system like Oracle E-business suite (EBS) which needs more stable and secure servers in that time, and from their point of view, they decided to use Oracle unbreakable and Oracle Solaris platforms as a hands on experience for their long study period at time to simulate and applied all approaches and scenarios they learned.

▩ Technologies used:
➣ ORACLE EBS for Intel 64-bit
➣ BIND DNS Server, ISC DHCP Server
➣ Virualization
➣ ORACLE Solaris Zones
➣ Backup Solution
➣ Monitoring Solution (Zabbix)

▩ Operating Systems used:
➣ ORACLE UEK (Unbreakable Enterprise Kernel) v6.5
➣ ORACLE Solaris 11.1
➣ Windows Server 2012 ( For testing issues )
➣ Window 7 ( For customer sides )

▩ Job Role:

projects.title: Simplified Multi-Services Deployment (SMSD) - [ MCIT Graduation Project ] ♦ Senior Supervisor
projects.description:
▩ Description:
➣ This is the 2nd one of graduation projects for MCIT scholarship in specialized UNIX/Linux Systems Administration Track I supervised as a goal of my job.  
➣ This project has a wide vision about automation deployment and developing for all Linux services and daemons with one click in a pretty Terminal User Interface (TUI)
➣ In the project I was strongly believing in my trainees at the time, they made a revolution in the automation and continuous integration era that called today as (DevOps).
➣ The main goal for this project is achieving satisfaction, transparency, automation, and flexibility for all Linux system administrators whom strive to achieve their needs
➣ SMSD had been implemented at that time upon both of Ninja O.Ss ( ORACLE UEK & ORACLE Solaris ) to achieve the integration between all independent platforms that I saw and believed in that time.

▩ Technologies used:
➣ Apacahe, BIND DNS, ISC DHCP
➣ BASH Scripting Lang
➣ NFS, Samba
➣ OpenSSH + Host Authentication
➣ Yum, IPtables
➣ Advanced Bash Scripting Lang ( Dialog tool )
➣ IPFW
➣ ORACLE Solaris Zones
➣ Virtualization

▩ Operating System used:
➣ ORACLE UEK v6.5
➣ ORACLE Solaris v11.1

projects.title: Link Aggregation for Multiple ADSL/T1 lines from various ISPs with a permanent Fail-Over
projects.description:
▩ Description:
➣ This project is more suitable for any enterprise or limited business companies (Large, Medium, ans Small scale) that desire in its first needs to make a permanent method for aggregating more than ADSL line for continuous downloading, uploading, file sharing, and browsing, also it guarantees fail-over method for any crashed lines. It is more convenient for call centers especially in VOIP technologies.

▩ Technologies used:
➣ Network bounding applied upon CentOS v6.5
➣ Astresik server as a VOIP approach
➣ OpenSSH + Host Authentication
➣ Linux kernel 2.6.x + Modprobe

▩ Hardware Platforms:
➣ HP Proliant DL-Series ( 2 servers )
➣ Apple desktops ( > 20 PCs )

projects.title: Fully Automated (ISP) Internet Service Provider
projects.description:
▩ Description:
➣ Our project is suitable for any enterprise size (Medium or Small scale) that need to control uploads, downloads and to control surfed pages over it's network. We offered an easy way to control your Internet bandwidth with low cost in compare to other systems or technologies.
➣ Automate rules generation & execution on the above sections and grant the control to the enterprise IT manager using Web interface to perform all admin tasks. This module was able to control TC, IPtables and Cisco devices automatically.
➣ Control access to the network and offers more security and reliability to the system using virtual LANs for every user

▩ Technologies used:
➣ Linux TC (Traffic Control) kernel tool.
➣ DansGurdian for content filtering.
➣ Squid Proxy Server
➣ SquidGuard
➣ Berkeley Database
➣ Linux Firewall (IPtables)
➣ Java SE, Servlets and JSP

▩ Hardware platforms used:
➣ Dell Tower-Series ( for servers )
➣ Toshiba Laptops ( for clients )
➣ Dell Laptops ( for clients )
➣ Cisco Routers and Switches
